artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Yamashiroya Jinbei
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 276; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 138, p. 295.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: three separate sheets; miniature railroad with women and men in European dress inside car behind locomotive; women and men in LRC; couple at left beneath a walkway, with a view of boats and water behind them; yellow, brown and blue brick wall in middle ground, with figures in Asian dress and horses walking and standing by railings along top of colorful brick wall
dimension: 14 1/4 × 9 3/4 in. (36.2 × 24.77 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban triptych)
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
title: Famous places in Tokyo, Takanawa: Picture of . Complete picture of a steam locomotive and railroad
